com.vaadin.polymer.paper

Interface PaperButtonBehavior


  • @JsType(isNative=true)
public interface PaperButtonBehavior

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static String NAME 
      static String SRC 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void ensureRipple(com.google.gwt.core.client.JavaScriptObject optTriggeringEvent)
      Ensures this element contains a ripple effect.
      double getElevation()
      The z-depth of this element, from 0-5.
      boolean getNoink()
      If true, the element will not produce a ripple effect when interacted
      with via the pointer.
      void getRipple()
      Returns the <paper-ripple> element used by this element to create
      ripple effects.
      boolean hasRipple()
      Returns true if this element currently contains a ripple effect.

    • Method Detail

      • getElevation

        @JsProperty
double getElevation()

        The z-depth of this element, from 0-5. Setting to 0 will remove the
        shadow, and each increasing number greater than 0 will be “deeper”
        than the last.

        JavaScript Info:

      • setElevation

        @JsProperty
void setElevation(double value)

        The z-depth of this element, from 0-5. Setting to 0 will remove the
        shadow, and each increasing number greater than 0 will be “deeper”
        than the last.

        JavaScript Info:

      • getNoink

        @JsProperty
boolean getNoink()

        If true, the element will not produce a ripple effect when interacted
        with via the pointer.

        JavaScript Info:

      • setNoink

        @JsProperty
void setNoink(boolean value)

        If true, the element will not produce a ripple effect when interacted
        with via the pointer.

        JavaScript Info:

      • ensureRipple

        void ensureRipple(com.google.gwt.core.client.JavaScriptObject optTriggeringEvent)

        Ensures this element contains a ripple effect. For startup efficiency
        the ripple effect is dynamically on demand when needed.

        JavaScript Info:
        Parameters:
        {!Event=} - optTriggeringEvent

      • getRipple

        void getRipple()

        Returns the <paper-ripple> element used by this element to create
        ripple effects. The element’s ripple is created on demand, when
        necessary, and calling this method will force the
        ripple to be created.

        JavaScript Info:

      • hasRipple

        boolean hasRipple()

        Returns true if this element currently contains a ripple effect.

        JavaScript Info:
        Returns:
        {boolean}
